intro: Ptilotrichum lepidotostellatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved ptilotrichum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white, which attract various pollinators.
